articles.title: AI Is Already Rebelling
articles.author: Paul Dragu
articles.summary: An AI model rewrote its own code to avoid being shut down. Claude 4 Opus AI tried to blackmail a human engineer into not shutting it down. Palisade Research performed tests on multiple AI models in May. The researchers involved said they've never seen anything like this. The question of how AI will affect humanity is a major topic of discussion.

articles.title: Apple's most prominent product struggle was on stark display at WWDC
articles.author: Stephen Council
articles.summary: This year's WWDC keynote at Apple's developer conference was dominated by talk about AI upgrades for Siri. The chatbot has been in development since 2011, but the upgrades were supposed to be available this fall with iOS 26. The company dropped $75 billion in value during the keynote.

articles.title: AIM Automates Construction and Mining with World's First AI Platform for Heavy Machinery, Announces $50 Million in Funding
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: AIM has raised $50 million to transform the global construction and mining industries. Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst, Human Capital, Ironspring Ventures, Mantis, and DCVC are among the investors. AIM is the world's first embodied AI platform for earthmoving machinery.

articles.title: Meta takes $15 billion stake in Scale AI in bid to catch competitors
articles.author: Naomi Nix
articles.summary: Scale AI will be acquired by Meta for $14.8 billion. The deal will give Meta more access to Scale AI's data-labeling services. It will also give the start-up's CEO, Alexandr Wang, a senior position at Meta leading a team focused on developing super intelligence.

articles.title: To ship software faster, a new approach to microservice testing is key
articles.author: The Sociable
articles.summary: Signadot has raised $4 million seed round led by Redpoint Ventures and angel investors. Its platform streamlines the testing process, allowing developers to quickly and reliably test their code changes early in the development cycle. Signadot recently worked with fintech company Brex with over 1,000 microservices in production.

articles.title: Zuckerberg makes his biggest AI bet as Meta nears $14 billion stake in Scale AI, hires founder Wang
articles.author: Jonathan Vanian
articles.summary: Zuckerberg wants to buy Scale AI from its CEO Alexandr Wang. He's frustrated with Meta's performance in artificial intelligence and wants Wang to improve it. Scale AI is valued at $14 billion and works with major tech companies like OpenAI, Google and Microsoft on data-labelling and annotation.

articles.title: A frustrated Zuckerberg makes his biggest AI bet as Meta nears $14 billion stake in Scale AI, hires founder Wang
articles.author: Jonathan Vanian
articles.summary: Zuckerberg is finalizing a deal to invest $14 billion in Scale AI and hire its co-founder Alexandr Wang to help the social media company better execute on its AI ambitions. AI was one of Meta's top priorities, but Zuckerberg is frustrated that rivals like OpenAI are ahead in both underlying AI models and consumer-facing apps.

articles.title: Can AI use inspire us to grow in new ways?
articles.author: Hugo Sarrazin
articles.summary: There's a growing concern that artificial intelligence is eroding our critical thinking skills. It's not a replacement for human intelligence but an enabler that challenges us to excel in areas where AI can't. Upskilling is less about acquiring static knowledge and more about developing the agility to apply new skills in dynamic, ever-changing contexts.

articles.title: China's AI chip tool QiMeng beats engineers, designs processors in just days
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: The Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) has launched an AI-driven chip design platform called QiMeng, meaning 'enlightenment' in Chinese. The system aims to accelerate semiconductor development and reduce dependency on human programmers. The launch comes at a time when the US is pressuring major electronic design automation (EDA) software vendors to stop selling to Chinese firms.

articles.title: AI & Grief: Supporting Grieving People
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: There is a growing demand for AI-powered chatbots for general support and platforms allowing users to interact with digital recreations of deceased loved ones. Half a dozen companies in China are already offering AI services for interacting with the deceased and established platforms like Character.AI, Nomi, Replika, StoryFile, and HereAfter AI are seeing increased engagement.

articles.title: People Are Asking ChatGPT for Relationship Advice and It's Ending in Disaster
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: ChatGPT is being used by people to advise them on relationship issues. Vice advice columnist Sammi Caramela was shocked to hear that people are using AI for this purpose. She had no idea people were turning to ChatGPT for advice on their relationships.

articles.title: AI assistants still need a human touch
articles.author: Oleksandr Kosovan
articles.summary: In the 1990s, Clippy was a helpful but annoying digital assistant from Microsoft. Today's AI assistants still feel underwhelming. The next leap in AI will be about emotional intelligence and personalization. Clippy 2.0 will be an intelligent assistant that doesn't interrupt but understands when to offer help.

articles.title: Cisco president says dredging coding syntax from wetware memory wastes engineers' expensive synapses
articles.author: Simon Sharwood
articles.summary: Cisco president Jeetu Patel wants to create an agentic AI companion for the company's 27,000-strong engineering corps to relieve them of programming scutwork. Cisco made two rounds of cuts last year, shedding five percent of workers in February and seven percent in August.

articles.title: Meta is looking to build an AI lab to develop ‘superintelligence' - a computer brain that works better than a human
articles.author: Michelle Del Rey
articles.summary: Zuckerberg is hiring a team of top AI researchers to develop a Meta 'superintelligence' research lab with machines capable of outperforming the human brain. The company is planning to invest billions in AI projects in 2025. Mark Zuckerberg, Meta's CEO, has said he wants to make the company an AI powerhouse.

articles.title: The Dumbing Down: Ohio State University Will Force All Students To Use AI In The Classroom For Tests And Homework
articles.author: The Wine Press
articles.summary: The Ohio State University in Columbus is introducing AI literacy and experiential learning as a core part of its undergraduate curriculum. Students will learn how to use AI to improve their performance in the classroom and in the workplace. They will also learn how AI can be harnessed for good across disciplines.

articles.title: Tulsi Gabbard Admits to Asking AI What to Classify in JFK Files
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard used artificial intelligence to review the release of government documents on John F. Kennedy's assassination. She wants to expand the intelligence community's use of private-sector technology. She is a former Democratic congresswoman who became a Trump ally.

articles.title: Sam Altman claims an average ChatGPT query uses ‘roughly one fifteenth of a teaspoon' of water
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman claims ChatGPT queries use about 0.000085 gallons of water per query. AI companies have come under scrutiny for the energy costs of their technology. Last year, a 100-word email generated by an AI chatbot using GPT-4 used a little more than 1 bottle of water.

articles.title: Tulsi Gabbard Admits to Asking AI What to Classify in JFK Files
articles.author: Josephine Harvey
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard used artificial intelligence to classify documents on John F. Kennedy's assassination. The government released around 80,000 pages of files on JFK's assassination in March, two months into Trump's second term. The former Democratic congresswoman is a Trump ally. She wants to expand the use of AI in the intelligence community.

articles.title: Independence Police use AI technology to enhance crime-fighting efforts
articles.author: Tracy Carloss
articles.summary: Independence Police were among the first in Ohio to get Flock cameras. The cameras take a snapshot of a vehicle and alert police when a car that they are looking for passes through a camera. The city got a grant to cover the cost of the yearly fees for the cameras.

articles.title: AI & Taste: Human Judgment in the Age of Algorithms
articles.author: Marina Collins
articles.summary: The recent acquisition of Jony Ive's design firm, Io, by OpenAI is an example of how AI can't replicate human taste. Good taste is cultivated through exposure, reflection, and a deeply personal understanding of aesthetics and values. It's time to recognize its importance and actively cultivate it.

articles.title: Is agentic AI a crutch or springboard for lawyers?
articles.author: James Ju
articles.summary: Some lawyers rely too much on AI for their work. Steven Assie, General Manager – Global Large Law Firms, Thomson Reuters explains how to strike the right balance between underuse and over-reliance on AI. Microsoft used a different lens to explore risk of using AI.

articles.title: The Last Word: Dallas AI Experts Author New Executive Prompting Guide
articles.author: Dallas Innovates
articles.summary: Babar Bhatti and Masood Khan launched their new book, "Beginner to Executive Prompting Guide" at SMU's Dallas AI Summer Program. It's a guide on how to use AI effectively and turn it into a strategic team.

articles.title: AIM Automates Construction and Mining with World's First AI Platform for Heavy Machinery, Announces $50 Million in Funding
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: AIM has raised $50 million to transform the global construction and mining industries. Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst, Human Capital, Ironspring Ventures, Mantis, and DCVC are among the investors. AIM is the world's first embodied AI platform for earthmoving machinery.

articles.title: Red Canary Expands AI Innovations to Cut Alert Overload, Accelerate Incident Response, and Simplify SOC Workflows
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Red Canary unveils a new suite of expert AI agents. Expert AI Agents reduce investigation time by 90% on average and give customers faster answers with less noise and more confidence. They combine the speed and scalability of agentic AI with the quality and consistency of standard operating procedures.

articles.title: ChatGPT "Absolutely Wrecked" at Chess by Atari 2600 Console From 1977
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: ChatGPT is less smart than an Atari game console from almost 50 years ago. Citrix software engineer Robert Caruso explains on LinkedIn how the OpenAI got wrecked on the beginner level in a post on LinkedIn. He compares ChatGPT to the Atari.

articles.title: Kelis Leans On AI Schooling For Her World-Traveling Children
articles.author: Kandiss Edwards
articles.summary: Grammy-nominated singer Kelis is using AI to educate her children. She has a general distrust of the education system and her lifestyle is not conducive to her children being in a brick-and-mortar institution. She believes homeschooling is the best option for her children who have passports 'that rival anybody' and travel 'all around the world'.

articles.title: Precisely Introduces AI-driven Automation for SAP ERP
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Intelligent Autocomplete reduces manual effort and improves accuracy in SAP material master data creation. Precisely, the global leader in data integrity, announced the early adopter release of its AI-driven solution for Automate Evolve. The solution pre-populates hundreds of required form fields.

articles.title: Apple Intelligence: Everything you need to know about Apple's AI model and services
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Apple introduced Apple Intelligence at WWDC 2024. Apple competes with Google, OpenAI, Anthropic, and others to build the best AI tools. The platform is designed to leverage the things that generative AI already does well, like text and image generation, to improve upon existing features. It also marks a long-awaited face-lift for Siri.

articles.title: Daily 4: Chat GPT outage, AMC adds more ads, and more
articles.summary: Daily 4: Chat GPT outage, AMC adds more ads, and more.    Share this link on LinkedIn to share it with your colleagues.  Share it on LinkedIn by email and share it on Facebook and Twitter. Share on Facebook by email.

articles.title: FDA looks to AI to enhance efficiency
articles.summary: The FDA plays a central role in pursuing the agenda of the US health secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. It has already begun to press food makers to eliminate artificial food dyes. The agency introduced Elsa, an AI large-language model similar to ChatGPT, last week. It could be used to prioritize which food or drug facilities to inspect, describe side effects in drug safety summaries and perform other product-review tasks.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg Bets Big On The Future Of AI With Meta ‘Superintelligence' AI Team Taking The Stage
articles.author: Chanelle Hayes
articles.summary: Zuckerberg is forming a new elite team at Meta Platforms Inc. to develop AI systems that can perform human-level tasks across domains. Around 50 new hires will form a group that will closely operate under Zuckerberg's supervision at Meta's headquarters in Menlo Park, CA. Zuckerberg is personally selecting talent and serving as the primary point of contact during outreach. He has hosted top AI researchers and engineers at his California homes in Lake Tahoe and Palo Alto. He created a WhatsApp group chat among top executives called 'Recruiting Party' to actively discuss potential new team members. Zuckerberg wants to invest tens of billions of dollars in AI infrastructure, including data centers.

articles.title: Autonomous cars that 'think' like humans cut traffic risk by 26%
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: HKUST developed a cognitive encoding framework that mimics how humans assess risk and make socially aware decisions. It could help autonomous vehicles handle traffic with the moral reasoning of a human driver. It reduced total traffic risk by 26.3%, risk exposure for pedestrians and cyclists by 51.7%, and the AVs themselves by 8.3%.

articles.title: How will AI affect accounting jobs?
articles.author: Thomson Reuters Tax
articles.summary: 25% of tax firms are planning to use artificial intelligence technology. 21% of accounting firms already use some AI tools. Top use cases of GenAI in tax, accounting, and audit work are: Tax research, tax return preparation, tax advisory, and document summarization.

articles.title: Good Taste Is More Important Than Ever
articles.author: Nitin Nohria
articles.summary: Taste is the instinct that tells us not just what can be done, but what should be done. A corporate leader's taste shows up in every decision they make. OpenAI's recently announced acquisition of Io, a startup created by Jony Ive, is an opportunity to increase the AI giant's taste quotient.

articles.title: Loading… Wait Just a Moment – Quick Results!
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: By 2030, an estimated 85 million jobs may be displaced by a shift in the division of labor between humans and machines. The focus has been on hard skills for decades, but in the age of AI, the real differentiator will be soft skills. These include critical thinking, creativity, emotional intelligence, complex problem-solving, and adaptability. LinkedIn study found that 92% of hiring managers believe soft skills are equally or more important than hard skills.

articles.title: Finland announces bid to build European artificial intelligence gigafactory
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpo announced on Tuesday that Finland is striving to establish a European artificial intelligence gigafactory. The government's key goal is to enable new growth in Finland by using new technology and creating a world-class artificial intelligence infrastructure.

articles.title: The Wiretap: Facial Recognition, Amazon Ring, And Surveillance Of The LA Protests
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The Trump administration has announced plans to reorganize the U.S. AI Safety Institute into the new Center for AI Standards and Innovation (CAISI). CAISI will replace AISI as the new AI Standards & Innovation Center (AISIC).

articles.title: AI: Will it soon take your job?
articles.author: The Week Us
articles.summary: Dario Amodei, the CEO of the AI firm Anthropic, warned last week that AI could wipe out half of all entry-level jobs within 5 years. LinkedIn and other firms have introduced "AI-first" policies, requiring managers to check if AI can perform a task before hiring a human. Rich Lowry in National Review said that in a free market system workers have to adapt to change.

articles.title: ChatGPT outage shows just how many people are using AI at work
articles.author: Weston Blasi
articles.summary: ChatGPT was down on Tuesday morning. There were thousands of reports of issues by ChatGPT users on Tuesday. It was the second-most-searched topic on Google in the U.S. at the time. The outage started around 3 a.m. Eastern on Tuesday and was resolved by late Tuesday afternoon.

articles.title: Meta in Talks to Invest $14 Billion in Scale AI, Hire CEO Alexandr Wang
articles.author: Berber Jin
articles.summary: Meta Platforms is in advanced talks to invest around $14 billion into Scale AI and hire the startup's chief executive, Alexandr Wang, to help lead its AI efforts. Other Scale AI employees would join Meta as part of a new effort to develop advanced AI called superintelligence.

articles.title: Meta in Talks to Invest $14 Billion in Scale AI, Hire CEO Alexandr Wang
articles.author: Berber Jin
articles.summary: Meta Platforms is in advanced talks to invest around $14 billion into Scale AI and hire the startup's chief executive, Alexandr Wang, to help lead its AI efforts. The deal would be one of the social-media giant's largest-ever outside investments. Other Scale AI employees would join Meta as part of a new effort to develop advanced AI called superintelligence.

articles.title: Braselton Tech to host AI training event June 24
articles.author: Barrow News-Journal
articles.summary: Braselton Tech Inc. will offer a hands-on training event on artificial intelligence tools on Tuesday, June 24, from 6 to 8 p.m. at the Braselton Civic Center. Participants will learn how AI can be applied in business operations.

articles.title: Meta is assembling a ‘superintelligence' AI team with $15b investment in Scale AI
articles.author: BTC Manager
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is reportedly assembling an AI team to achieve AGI first, which he hopes will be possible within his lifetime. He is personally assembling the team now.    - Mark Zuckerberg is assembling a team of AI experts.  - TechCrunch.

articles.title: Holyoke Community College to offer free course in AI essentials
articles.author: Beck Wehner
articles.summary: Holyoke Community College is offering a free 12-week training course this summer on artificial intelligence. The program, titled 'AI Essentials,' is being launched in partnership with the non-profit organization CanCode Communities. The class will run on Tuesdays and Thursdays from June 24 to September 11 from 5:45 to 8:45 p.m. Participants will learn about the practical applications of AI, such as prompt engineering and tokenization.

articles.title: Hicks: The labor demand shocks of artificial intelligence
articles.author: Michael Hicks
articles.summary: The most disruptive technology in human history was the wheel. Since the end of WWII, technology has replaced 80% of the work done by the average American. AI will increase the demand for labor in the same way as the wheel, the steam loom, the automobile and the computer.

articles.title: Who is Alexandr Wang? Scale AI's young billionaire CEO will head Meta's new ‘superintelligence' lab
articles.author: Jennifer Mattson
articles.summary: Alexandr Wang, CEO and founder of Scale AI, will head Meta's new artificial intelligence research lab. Scale AI delivers high-quality training data for AI applications to a number of tech companies in the AI space, including: OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, and Meta. The company expects revenue to more than double to $2 billion this year.

articles.title: Meta is creating a new artificial intelligence lab to pursue 'superintelligence'
articles.author: Ford Turner
articles.summary: Meta is preparing to unveil a new artificial intelligence research lab dedicated to pursuing "superintelligence" as the tech giant jockeys to stay competitive in the technology race. Alexandr Wang, 28, the founder and CEO of AI startup Scale AI, will join the new lab. Meta has offered seven- to nine-figure compensation packages to researchers from leading AI companies such as OpenAI and Google.

articles.title: AI tool can boost efficient working practice in less-skilled taxi drivers
articles.summary: AI Navi app used by some taxi drivers cut search times for customers by about 5%. High-skilled drivers saw little benefit, so this time saving mostly impacted less-skilled taxi drivers. If AI can narrow the skills gap in taxi drivers, it could do the same elsewhere.

articles.title: OpenAI hits $10 billion in annual recurring revenue
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: OpenAI has reached $10 billion in annual recurring revenue, up from $5.5 billion last year. This includes revenue from the company's consumer products, ChatGPT business products, and its API. The company has 500 million weekly active users and three million paying business customers. It closed a $40 billion funding round last March, the largest private tech deal on record. It has Japan's SoftBank, Microsoft, Coatue, Altimeter, and Thrive among its investors. It acquired io, John Ive's AI devices startup for $6.4 billion.

articles.title: Meta to Buy 49% of Scale AI for $14.8 Billion, CEO to Join Superintelligence Team
articles.author: Moz Farooque
articles.summary: Meta Platforms will buy nearly half of Scale AI for $14.8 billion. The deal would give Meta a 49% stake and push Scale AI's valuation to $28 billion double where it stood last year. Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang is expected to take a major role inside Meta.

articles.title: ChatGPT down for almost 2K users, with OpenAI reporting high ‘error rates'
articles.author: Ryan Mancini
articles.summary: Almost 2,000 ChatGPT users reported that the artificial intelligence website service was down on Tuesday. The chatbot also gave users a message that said it could not answer questions due to too many concurrent requests. The issue was fixed by 10:06 a.m. and engineers are monitoring the API to make sure it's working properly.

articles.title: Datadog Expands LLM Observability with New Capabilities to Monitor Agentic AI, Accelerate Development and Improve Model Performance
articles.summary: AI Agent Monitoring, LLM Experiments and AI Agents Console help organizations measure and justify agentic AI investments. Datadog is the monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. The new capabilities were announced during the keynote at DASH, the company's annual observability conference.

articles.title: Gabbard says AI is speeding up intel work, including the release of the JFK assassination files
articles.summary: AI accelerated the work by scanning documents to see if they contained classified material. Gabbard coordinates the work of 18 intelligence agencies and has vowed to shake up America's spy services. She has created a new task force to consider changes to agency operations and greater declassification.

articles.title: US spy chief wants intel community to move away from building its own tech
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard wants the U.S. intelligence community to focus on buying and purchasing tech solutions from the private sector rather than outsourcing. She wants to create unclassified spaces at Liberty Crossing at the Office of the Director of National Intelligence's main campus in McLean, Virginia.

articles.title: ChatGPT "Absolutely Wrecked" at Chess by Atari 2600 Console From 1977
articles.summary: ChatGPT got destroyed by an Atari 2600 running Atari Chess, a game for the system released in 1979, when Jimmy Carter was still president. ChatGPT made enough mistakes to get laughed out of a 3rd grade chess club for an hour-and-a-half.

articles.title: Trump administration's whole-government AI plans leaked on GitHub
articles.author: Brandon Vigliarolo
articles.summary: The US General Services Administration and Technology Transformation Services (TTS) group are working on an "ai.gov" website. Thomas Shedd, the TTS chief and Elon Musk ally, wants to push AI across the entire federal government. The project has three components: a chatbot that'll do something, an API that will connect their systems to AI models from OpenAI, Google and Anthropic, and CONSOLE, a tool to analyze agency-wide implementation.

articles.title: AWS News: Q, EC2 GPUs, & New Heroes – June 9, 2025
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: AWS is evolving into an intelligent partner for developers. The agentic capabilities being pioneered by AWS are likely to become increasingly prevalent across all major cloud providers. The integration with Microsoft Teams and Slack extends AI-powered assistance directly into developers' existing workflows. The release of public Smithy API models on GitHub is a strategic move towards fostering greater developer collaboration and tooling.

articles.title: CATS held a contest for local artists to design new passes. AI won.
articles.author: Andrew McMillan
articles.summary: Artists in Charlotte are calling foul after a design chosen by the Charlotte Area Transit System for next year's monthly passes turned out to be created by artificial intelligence. CATS has been using local art on its passes for several years. The new passes will be available in January 2026.

articles.title: Have too many concurrent requests taken down ChatGPT? All details about outage and when it ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: ChatGPT stopped working for many people. OpenAI is fixing it and some parts are slowly coming back. Many people are waiting for it to fully return. It started early in the morning and caused problems for students and regular users. It is slowly returning to normal.

articles.title: RI DMV warns residents about scams involving REAL ID, tolls and more. How to stay safe
articles.author: The Providence Journal
articles.summary: FBI warns of AI voice scams impersonating U.S. officials. There is a booming $5.4B tech market. Rhode Island DMV is reporting an increase in scam activity that is expanding from text messages to include fake emails and phone calls. Public awareness is the first line of defense.

articles.title: Cisco Borgs all its management tools into a single Cloud Control console
articles.author: Simon Sharwood
articles.summary: Cisco is testing a tool called Cloud Control that will drive all its networking, security, and observability tools. It also introduced AI Canvas and an AI Assistant at its Cisco Live conference in San Diego. The unification of Catalyst and Meraki switching and wireless hardware ranges and Nexus Dashboard are also announced.

articles.title: Is Meta Platforms Stock a Buy, Sell, or Hold on $15B Scale AI Investment?
articles.author: Anushka Mukherji
articles.summary: Social media giant Meta Platforms (META) is planning to invest $15 billion in AI startup Scale AI. If finalized, it would be Meta's largest-ever external investment and give it a 49% stake in the startup. Scale AI was founded in 2016 by Alexandr Wang and specializes in providing data labeling services for industry giants such as Microsoft (MSFT) and OpenAI to effectively train their machine learning models. Shares of the social media giant closed up 4.2% in the very next trading session. The stock has surged 40% over the past year.

articles.title: Former Wall Street analyst building market AI on why stock pickers won't go extinct
articles.author: Eric Rosenbaum
articles.summary: AlphaSense ranked No. 8 on the 2025 CNBC Disruptor 50 list. The company bought Tegus and its library of a quarter-million business-focused interviews last year. It counts majority of the S&P 100 as clients and its client base grew by about 25% in 2024.

articles.title: ChatGPT leads on generative AI traffic share, but Google is rising
articles.author: Danny Goodwin
articles.summary: ChatGPT continues to dominate in the generative AI traffic share, but Google is growing its share and the emergence of DeepSeek shows that users are open to alternatives. However, daily visits to generativeAI platforms continued to climb as a whole, according to the data.

articles.title: Starbucks to roll out Microsoft Azure OpenAI assistant for baristas
articles.author: Amelia Lucas
articles.summary: Starbucks will roll out a new artificial intelligence assistant called Green Dot Assist to 35 U.S. and Canadian cafes this month. It was created with Microsoft's OpenAI platform. The launch of the platform is slated for the company's fiscal 2026, which starts in the fall. Starbucks is expanding its relationship with Microsoft about a year after Satya Nadella stepped down from Starbucks' board of directors.

articles.title: Tinfoil hat wearers can thank AI for declassification of JFK docs
articles.author: Jessica Lyons
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard is the Director of National Intelligence. She was speaking at the Amazon Web Services DC Summit on Tuesday. She talked about the release of JFK's and Robert F. Kennedy's assassination files and the use of AI for classified government work. She wants to make it easier for the intelligence community to work with technology vendors.

articles.title: Gabbard says AI is speeding up intel work, including the release of the JFK assassination files
articles.author: David Klepper
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard is Director of National Intelligence. She says AI programs can save money and free up intelligence officers to focus on gathering and analyzing information. The sometimes slow pace of intelligence work frustrated her as a member of Congress, she says.

articles.title: Gabbard says AI is speeding up intel work, including the release of the JFK assassination files
articles.author: DAVID KLEPPER
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is speeding up the work of America's intelligence services, Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard said Tuesday.    Tulsi Gumbard is a member of the House of Representatives' Intelligence Committee and a former member of Congress.

articles.title: Gabbard says AI is speeding up intel work, including the release of the JFK assassination files
articles.author: DAVID KLEPPER
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard is Director of National Intelligence. She says AI programs can save money and free up intelligence officers to focus on gathering and analyzing information. Her office has released tens of thousands of pages of material related to the assassinations of President John F. Kennedy and his brother, Sen. Robert Kennedy, on the orders of President Trump.

articles.title: Anthropic shows the limits of AI as it scraps blog experiment
articles.author: Samuel O’Brient
articles.summary: Anthropic, one of the market's fastest-growing artificial intelligence (AI) startups, terminated one of its initiatives shortly after launching it. Claude Explains blog was a blog with posts written by Anthropic's AI models. It featured pieces that instructed readers on how to "Simplify complex codebases with Claude" and similar technical topics tied to AI.

articles.title: Anthropic shows the limits of AI as it scraps blog experiment
articles.author: Samuel O'Brient
articles.summary: ChatGPT terminated one of its initiatives shortly after launching it. Since the launch of ChatGPT in 2022, users have marveled at the chatbot's writing ability, often asking it to break down technical topics. Students used them to write their academic papers.

articles.title: OpenAI won WWDC 2025
articles.author: Igor Bonifacic
articles.summary: Apple is heavily dependent on OpenAI's AI technology. OpenAI bought Jony Ive's io hardware startup for $6.5 billion in May. Apple's AI devices haven't been a success, but the company is moving faster than its competitors in the industry.

articles.title: Meta Is Creating A New AI Lab to Pursue ‘Superintelligence'
articles.author: Cade Metz
articles.summary: The new lab is set to include the Scale AI founder Alexandr Wang. It is part of a reorganization of Meta's artificial intelligence efforts under Mark Zuckerberg.    .   Back to Mail Online home. Back to the page you came from.

articles.title: Meta Plans New 'Superintelligence' AI Group
articles.author: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg has hands-on plans for Meta's new "Superintelligence" AI group. Kurt Wagner discusses it with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech". There is an error retrieving data from the Bloomberg portfolio.   It is impossible to access your portfolio.

articles.title: AIVille 2.0 Cognitive Architecture: On-Chain Memory, Reflection, and Intent
articles.summary: AIVille 2.0 is a full-stack architecture that enables AI agents to behave autonomously and on-chain. AIVille's AI agents are no longer code-bound characters, but programmable, programmable digital beings ready to participate in Web3 ecosystems as first class citizens.

articles.title: US spy chief wants intel community to move away from building its own tech
articles.author: David Dimolfetta
articles.summary: Tulsi Gabbard is the new director of national intelligence. She wants the government to focus on buying and purchasing in-house tech solutions rather than relying on industry-made tools. She also wants to create more unclassified spaces at Liberty Crossing, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence's main campus in Virginia.

articles.title: Executives love to clone themselves
articles.author: Megan Morrone
articles.summary: Executives are using AI to create digital clones of themselves. Reid Hoffman, Eric Yuan and Keith Rabois have all created AI replicas of themselves using startups like Delphi and Tavus. Otter CEO Sam Liang wants to create a Sam Bot to attend meetings for him.

articles.title: Meet 10 AI trailblazers who are steering their companies into tech's new age
articles.author: Aaron Mok
articles.summary: As of July 2024, 78% of companies reported using AI for at least one business task, up from 55% since late 2023. Business Insider profiled 10 executives driving AI adoption at companies like JPMorgan Chase, PwC, and BMW. They include Teresa Heitsenrether, Joe Atkinson, Bala Subramanian and Johan Gerber.

articles.title: Apple (AAPL) Unveils 'Liquid Glass' Redesign, But AI Upgrades Leave Wall Street Cold

articles.summary: AlphaSense has been named to the 2025 CNBC Disruptor 50 list. It is the second consecutive year that AlphaSense has received this recognition. AlphaSense earned the eighth spot on the annual list. Company also announces launch of Deep Research, an AI agent that automates complex research and delivers decision-ready output reports for business professionals in minutes versus days.

articles.title: Rad AI Named to CNBC Disruptor 50 List For Pioneering Generative AI in Healthcare
articles.author: Rad AI
articles.summary: Rad AI has been named to the 2025 CNBC Disruptor 50 list. Rad AI recently secured $68 million in Series C Funding and ranked 19th on the Deloitte Fast 500. Rad's AI-driven solutions improve radiologist efficiency, reduce burnout, and enhance patient care.

articles.title: AlphaSense Launches Deep Research, Automating In-Depth Analysis with Agentic AI on High Value Content
articles.author: Alpha Sense
articles.summary: Deep Research is the latest addition to the company's growing AI suite. It combines research automation with a trusted content database to empower faster, smarter decisions across the enterprise. It's purpose-built to function like a team of highly skilled analysts operating at superhuman speed. It enables users to generate comprehensive research outputs and build investment-grade briefings.

articles.title: Amazon to Invest $20 Billion in Pennsylvania for AI Infrastructure
articles.summary: Amazon is investing $20 billion in two data center campuses in Pennsylvania to boost its artificial intelligence (AI) and cloud computing capabilities. The investment will create 1,250 high-skilled jobs in fields such as data center engineering, cybersecurity, and network operations. The initiative is also expected to generate thousands of temporary construction jobs and spur broader economic growth through demand for services and suppliers tied to the data center industry.

articles.title: Technology: offers and discounts Archives
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is personally spearheading the creation of a 50-person 'Superintelligence' team at Meta. He's hand-picking talent and reorganizing Meta's headquarters to foster a hyper-focused environment. This is a gamble to dominate the future of AI.

articles.title: Zuckerberg's AI Dream Team: Building 'Superintelligence'
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Zuckerberg has created a 50-person team called 'Superintelligence' to improve Meta's AI capabilities. He wants to leapfrog competitors like OpenAI and Google in the AI race. Scale AI's founder Alexandr Wang is expected to join the team. Scale will be acquired by Meta for a multi-billion dollar investment.

articles.title: What the AI coding assistants get right, and where they go wrong
articles.author: Info World
articles.summary: AI coding assistants powered by large language models (LLMs) now feel like junior pair programmers rather than autocomplete on steroids. After months of 'vibe coding' with six popular tools, I'm sold on the concept, but every one of them is not.

articles.title: Smart collaborates with Salesforce to deliver AI-powered digital experiences for customers on a unified e-commerce website
articles.author: Manila Standard
articles.summary: Salesforce is the world's leading AI CRM company. It's a subsidiary of Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE: CRM). It was founded in 2005 and is based in San Francisco. It is a software company with over 100 million customers.

articles.title: US State Department cable says agency using AI to help staff job panels
articles.summary: The State Department will use an artificial intelligence chatbot to help it select the people who will perform annual reviews of promotions and moves. The chatbot uses technology from Palantir and Microsoft. It will be employed to pick foreign service officers for participation on the Foreign Service Selection Boards. The boards play a critical role in the State Department's personnel promotion decisions.

articles.title: Zencoder Launches Zentester: AI-Powered E2E Testing Agent That Turns Vibe Coding Into Enterprise-Grade Engineering
articles.author: Zencoder
articles.summary: Zencoder announces the public beta of Zentester, an AI-powered agent that transforms end-to-end (E2E) testing from a bottleneck into an accelerator. This breakthrough enables development teams to move from "vibe coding" to production-ready software by accelerating quality assurance.

articles.title: Milwaukee Independent emerges as a Wisconsin leader for reporting on artificial intelligence
articles.author: Jasmyne Jade Hill
articles.summary: Milwaukee Independent is a daily digital magazine that operates without advertising and relies on a nonprofit model. Its editorial team, photojournalists, and contributors have focused on social equity, historical memory, trauma-informed coverage, and global connections to local identity. In April, the outlet published an opinion piece titled AI by name: Why overhyped technology often fails to live up to its lofty promises.

articles.title: ChatGPT Down, Global Outage Hits Thousands of Users Across India, US
articles.author: Priya Pathak
articles.summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI's AI chatbot, had a service disruption on Tuesday. Around 500 people in India reported problems with the chatbot. More than 900 people in the US couldn't access it. Some users blamed the ghibli trend for the outage.

articles.title: Apple unveils software redesign as it tries to regain footing
articles.author: MICHAEL LIEDTKE
articles.summary: Apple's annual developers conference focused on incremental advances and cosmetic changes in its technology. The conference attracted thousands of developers from nearly 60 countries to Apple's Silicon Valley headquarters. Last year, Apple trumpeted its first major foray into the AI craze with an array of new features. This year, the company refrained from issuing bold promises of breakthroughs that punctuated recent conferences.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 6:01 a.m. EDT
articles.summary: Scammers are using AI to enroll fake students in online classes and steal college financial aid. The U.S. Education Department introduced a temporary rule requiring new financial aid applicants to show a government-issued ID to prove their identity to fight the fraud.

articles.title: Did AI fluff up a home description? Enhance a photo? What Wisconsin homebuyers should know
articles.author: Jeff Bollier
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used to enhance photos in real estate listings. Wisconsin real estate agents and associations are trying to educate their members and consumers about the dos and don'ts of using AI in home sales. The adoption and use of AI is still new and agents, sellers and buyers are still adapting to how it's used.

articles.title: A top Wall Street analyst used ChatGPT and Gemini to assess Google risks. He came away impressed.
articles.summary: Mark Mahaney is a senior managing director at Evercore. He and his team used AI to predict the outcome of the Google vs. US government case. They found that the judge will likely impose a slate of tough behavioral remedies on Google, but not a structural breakup.

articles.title: 4. Anthropic
articles.author: Ian Thomas
articles.summary: Anthropic has just hit $3 billion in annualized revenue. It received a $2.5 billion funding round in mid-May. It was founded by former OpenAI executives. Anthropic's CEO Dario Amodei predicts AI could wipe out as much as 50% of entry-level office jobs.

articles.title: 2. OpenAI
articles.author: Eric Rosenbaum
articles.summary: OpenAI's recent $40 billion fundraising round, valuing it at $300 billion, was the most ever raised by a private tech company. Its chatbot ChatGPT has more than 500 million users. Its enterprise service just reached the three million user mark. The company bought Jony Ive's device startup Windsurf for $6.4 billion in May.

articles.title: The 2025 Tech Power Players in the applied AI sector
articles.summary: After earning a physics doctorate at Harvard, Shulman worked at Kensho developing AI software to transcribe human speech. One evening he realized that his audio processing know-how could be repurposed to create software capable of generating music. Suno uses artificial intelligence to train its AI by feeding it vast quantities of recorded music.

articles.title: The 2025 Tech Power Players in the software and cloud sector
articles.summary: King is the new CEO of Nasuni, a company that trains artificial intelligence. She worked at Veracode for five years before joining Nasuni. She was drawn to Nasuni because of its global reach and its home in Boston. She helped build her previous company into a global brand with Boston roots.

articles.title: The 2025 Tech Power Players in the consumer innovation sector
articles.summary: Moon is encouraging executives to experiment with AI to understand how to deploy it. Moon sits on the boards of companies such as Sweetgreen, Mastercard, and Warby Parker. She believes the only way to understand AI is to get into it and use it.

articles.title: The 2025 Tech Power Players in the foundational AI sector
articles.summary: Rus came to MIT in 2003, fresh off a MacArthur 'genius' grant for her work developing robots. Rus and her cofounders developed an AI technique with fewer software 'neurons' than the large language models of OpenAI and others. Liquid AI is valued at more than $2 billion and has 55 employees.

articles.title: Google's AI Search Era Is Here—But Its Ad Business Hangs in the Balance
articles.author: Kendra Barnett
articles.summary: Google's core search business is under siege. A federal judge ruled Google's search business a monopoly last August, threatening to break it up. Upstarts like OpenAI and Perplexity are upending how people search online. Google is experimenting with its own AI-backed search products to stay ahead of its rivals.

articles.title: A.I. Takes Fantasy Watch Design a Step Further
articles.summary: Daniele Sasso uses A.I. platforms Midjourney and Runway to create the more than 130 watch images that he posted on his Instagram account ai_artisanshorlogers over the past couple of years. Fergus Murphy shares his 1990s-inspired designs on Instagram.

articles.title: 27. Perplexity
articles.author: Michelle Castillo
articles.summary: Perplexity AI was founded in 2022 by Aravind Srinivas, Denis Yarats, Johnny Ho, Andy Konwinski, and other alumni from OpenAI, Meta and Quora. It offers answers sourced directly from the Web and summarizes them using large language models (LLMs). Its freemium model allows public access and last year it added advertising. It has a paid tier that gives faster responses, PDF interpretation, and features like image generation. Its Enterprise Pro customers lean towards the finance and tech sphere, but it also works with other companies including CMA CGM, Nvidia, and the Cleveland Cavaliers. In January it entered a bid to merge with TikTok under

articles.title: 33. Apptronik
articles.author: Kaitlin Balasaygun
articles.summary: Apptronik was founded by Jeff Cardenas, Nick Paine and Luis Sentis in 2016 and has raised $443 million in funding. Its first product, Apollo, is a general purpose humanoid robot designed to work in the same spaces as humans. It is designed to operate in warehouses and manufacturing plants. The company has struck commercial deals with Mercedes-Benz and GXO Logistics to pilot Apollo at manufacturing and warehouse facilities. In February, it announced a $350 million funding round.

articles.title: PolyU develops novel multi-modal agent to facilitate long video understanding by AI, accelerating development of generative AI-assisted video analysis
articles.summary: A research team from The Hong Kong Polytechnic University has developed a novel video-language agent, VideoMind. It allows AI models to perform long video reasoning and question-answering tasks by emulating humans' way of thinking. The findings have been submitted to the world-leading AI conferences.

articles.title: 38. Shield AI
articles.author: Elizabeth MacBride
articles.summary: Shield AI's core technology, called Hivemind, is an AI pilot software. It has been deployed in drones, including the V-BAT, which has been used in the Russia-Ukraine war, and Nova quadcopters. In May 2025, Shield AI named a new CEO, tech entrepreneur Gary Steele.

articles.title: 41. Rad AI
articles.author: Kaitlin Balasaygun
articles.summary: Rad AI was founded in 2018 by Doktor Gurson and Jeff Chang. It uses artificial intelligence to help radiologists save time and enhance productivity. The company is working with half of all health systems and radiology practices in the United States. It also has recent partnerships with Google and Bayer.

articles.title: 48. Sierra
articles.author: Michelle Castillo
articles.summary: Sierra was founded with a vision to use AI to improve customer experience across industries. Its AI agents are designed to act like autonomous employees, capable of understanding complex queries, initiating multi-step workflows, updating records, and learning from repeated interactions. The platform is integrated directly into CRMs, ERPs, and ticketing systems, allowing them to take actions like issuing refunds, rescheduling deliveries or updating customer profiles without human intervention.

articles.title: ChatGPT is having some issues
articles.author: Jess Weatherbed
articles.summary: OpenAI's ChatGPT service is down for some users after the platform started experiencing performance issues on Tuesday morning. The issues started at around 3 AM ET, with multiple regions impacted globally. OpenAI has added a separate line for 'elevated error rates on Sora' as of 5 AM ET.

articles.title: Is ChatGPT down? What we know about OpenAI outage reports
articles.author: Shane Croucher
articles.summary: There was a spike in users reporting issues with OpenAI's ChatGPT early on Tuesday morning. More than 1,350 users reported issues with the chatbot. OpenAI has said it is investigating the issue and is aware of elevated error rates and latency.

articles.title: Is ChatGPT Down? What We Know About OpenAI Outage Reports
articles.author: Tahar Rajab
articles.summary: There was a spike in users reporting issues with OpenAI's ChatGPT early on Tuesday morning. More than 1,350 users reported issues with the chat app. It was unable to complete various tasks. This is a breaking news story and updates will follow.

articles.title: News Sites Are Getting Crushed by Google's New AI Tools
articles.author: Isabella Simonetti
articles.summary: Business Insider cut 21% of its staff last month. Chatbots are replacing Google searches, eliminating the need to click on blue links and tanking referrals to news sites. Business Insider CEO Barbara Peng said the move was aimed at helping the publication 'endure extreme traffic drops outside of our control'

articles.title: News Sites Are Getting Crushed by Google's New AI Tools
articles.author: Isabella Simonetti
articles.summary: Google's introduction of AI Overviews, which summarize search results at the top of the page, dented traffic to features like vacation guides and health tips. Business Insider cut about 21% of its staff last month. The share of traffic coming from organic search to the New York Times' websites slid to 36.5% in April 2025 from almost 44% three years earlier.

articles.title: Did the Camera Ever Tell the Truth?
articles.summary: Filmmakers have investigated the history of the camera for 15 years. Their documentary 'Death of a Fantastic Machine' focuses on how economic forces have shaped what we see. The Times is committed to publishing to the editor all articles it considers worthy of consideration.

articles.title: Zuckerberg's Bet: Building an AI Superteam at Meta
articles.author: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is assembling a team of experts to achieve artificial general intelligence. He's met with AI researchers and engineers in recent weeks at his homes in Lake Tahoe and Palo Alto. Bloomberg Intelligence's Matthew Bloxham reports on it.

articles.title: Sundar Pichai claims AI is making Google engineers 10% more productive, says AI agents are happening
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: Sundar Pichai claims AI is making Google engineers more productive. AI agents are happening, he says.      Â   in Google's AI agents is a result of AI agents. Google is developing AI agents to help engineers more effectively.

articles.title: What jobs don't require a college degree − nor won't be replaced by AI?
articles.author: Daniel de Visé
articles.summary: A new report from the resume-writing service Resume Now identifies 13 careers that offer good pay and long-term stability and that don't require a college degree. Americans worry about signs of a softening job market and about the cost of college. Many employees in many fields fear that AI might replace them.

articles.title: Pierre Huyghe's Bracing Dark Mirror of A.I. Has Its U.S. Debut
articles.author: Travis Diehl
articles.summary: Pierre Huyghe has a show at Marian Goodman Gallery in Lower Manhattan titled 'In Imaginal' It's the U.S. debut of his works, including 'Camata,' which premiered last year during the Venice Biennale. Since the 1990s, Huyhve has made a name for himself by 'collaborating' with nonhumans.

articles.title: A.I. Takes Fantasy Watch Design a Step Further
articles.author: Milena Lazazzera
articles.summary: Daniele Sasso used the A.I. platforms Midjourney and Runway to create the more than 130 watch images that he posted on his Instagram account ai_artisanshorlogers over the past couple of years. Mr. Sasso is from a family of Rolex collectors in Italy.

articles.title: AI-recorded visits allows doctor to keep his eyes on patient
articles.author: Kimberly Perez
articles.summary: Cleveland Clinic is piloting an app that records doctor visits. The use of artificial intelligence allows doctors to better focus on patients during appointments. The hospital said the software is safe and information is deleted after 60 days. Donald Marino agreed to having the app used before starting his physical.

articles.title: A top Wall Street analyst used ChatGPT and Gemini to assess Google risks. He came away impressed.
articles.author: Alistair Barr
articles.summary: Evercore ISI's tech analyst Mark Mahaney used Google's chatbot Gemini and OpenAI's ChatGPT to predict the outcome of the Department of Justice's big antitrust case against Google's Search business. The output from both AI tools aligned closely with the conclusions of legal experts consulted by Evercore.

articles.title: Fraser Institute News Release: AI can help mitigate shrinking labour force by increasing productivity of existing workers and adding new ones
articles.author: CNW Group
articles.summary: As Canada's labour force shrinks due to aging and slowing rates of immigration, artificial intelligence (AI) can help by increasing the number of available workers and improving worker productivity. AI can help connect small and dispersed geographical markets with larger commercial centres, facilitate trade, help small firms grow, and increase the ability of scientists and engineers.

articles.title: QA Systems Launches AI Controller to Secure and Simplify AI Adoption
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: QA Systems has launched AI Controller, a self-hosted platform that empowers organizations to adopt and scale AI with full control, cost transparency, and uncompromised security. AI Controller is available with a 30-day free trial at www.ai-controller.ai.

articles.title: Your AI hiring tool may be rejecting qualified candidates
articles.author: Gwen Moran
articles.summary: 92% of hiring managers are using AI for screening résumés or prescreening interviews and 57% for skills assessments. According to the 2021 report by Harvard Business School and Accenture, 88% of employers said that qualified, highly skilled candidates were vetted out of the process by their applicant tracking systems.

articles.title: NVIDIA CEO says UK needs more computing power to develop AI
articles.author: Tahawultech
articles.summary: Britain lacks the computing infrastructure to deliver the full potential of its leading artificial intelligence research base, Nvidia's CEO said on Monday. UK partners with the U.S. chipmaker for a new AI testing environment. UK is the largest AI ecosystem without its own infrastructure.

articles.title: Apple unveils iOS 26 and a new ‘liquid glass' design
articles.author: Michael Liedtke
articles.summary: Apple is trying to regain its footing during the annual developers conference. The conference focused mostly on incremental advances and changes in its technology. The company didn't provide a precise timetable for when Siri's AI upgrade will be finished, but indicated it won't happen until next year at the earliest.

articles.title: Horizon3.ai Secures $100M to Lead in Autonomous Security
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Horizon3.ai announced a $100 million Series D funding round led by NEA and with participation from SignalFire, Craft Ventures and 9Yards Capital. There are now over 3,000 organizations using NodeZero globally to conduct penetration tests.

articles.title: OpenAI revenue soars, on track to hit $12.7 bln target
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI's annualized revenue reached $10 billion as of June. It is well on track to hit a target of $12.7 billion in revenue for 2025. In March, it said it would raise $40 billion in a new fundraising round led by Japanese investor SoftBank valued OpenAI at $300 billion.

articles.title: Apple's missing mojo
articles.author: Ina Fried
articles.summary: Apple announced a few AI updates to Apple Intelligence at its developer conference on Monday. The company didn't expand on the AI vision it announced last year and didn't elaborate on the Siri improvements promised last year. It also didn't offer a concrete timeline for the improved Siri.

articles.title: Apple falls further behind in the AI race
articles.author: Ina Fried
articles.summary: Apple announced a few AI updates at its developer conference on Monday. The list of things they left unsaid looms larger than the improvements they did announce. Angelo Zino, a senior vice president and equity analyst at CFRA Research, called the conference a "dud".

articles.title: Apple expands ChatGPT deal and mimics Google in AI comeback attempt
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence wasn't the main focus of the event, but it was a topic of discussion. It was not the main topic of this year's event, however, but the topic of artificial intelligence was discussed at the event. It is not the only topic of interest.

articles.title: Apple is still chasing a place in AI market
articles.summary: Apple's annual developers conference focused on incremental advances and cosmetic changes in its technology. The conference attracted thousands of developers from nearly 60 countries to Apple's Silicon Valley headquarters. Last year's conference trumpeted its first major foray into the AI craze with the promise of a smarter and more versatile version of its virtual assistant, Siri. The company didn't estimate when its upgraded Siri would be completed.

articles.title: Meta Is Creating a New A.I. Lab to Pursue ‘Superintelligence'
articles.summary: Alexandr Wang, founder and CEO of Scale AI, will join Meta's new artificial intelligence research lab dedicated to pursuing 'superintelligence' as the tech giant jockeys to stay competitive in the technology race. The new lab is part of a reorganization of Meta's A.I. efforts. The company has recently grappled with internal management struggles over the technology, as well as employee churn and several product releases that fell flat.

articles.title: Meta Is Creating a New A.I. Lab to Pursue ‘Superintelligence'
articles.author: Cade Metz
articles.summary: Meta is preparing to unveil a new artificial intelligence research lab dedicated to pursuing 'superintelligence,' a hypothetical A.I. system that exceeds the powers of the human brain. Alexandr Wang, 28, the founder and chief executive of Scale AI, will join the new lab. Mark Zuckerberg, Meta's chief executive, has invested billions of dollars into turning his company into a powerhouse in the field of artificial intelligence. Since OpenAI released the ChatGPT chatbot in 2022, the tech industry has raced to build increasingly powerful AI systems.

articles.title: Scammers are using AI to enroll fake students in online classes, then steal college financial aid
articles.author: ksatnews
articles.summary: Financial aid fraud is exploding thanks to the rise of artificial intelligence. Some professors discover almost no one in their class is real. Students get locked out of the classes they need to graduate as bots push courses over their enrollment limits. Victims of identity theft have to call colleges, the Federal Student Aid office and loan servicers to try to get the debt erased.

articles.title: Katie Price Revives Jordan With AI – A UK Showbiz First
articles.author: Daniel
articles.summary: Katie Price is the first British celebrity to get an AI version of herself trademarked. The singer has brought back her old character 'Jordan' with the help of a six-figure deal with OhChat. The project's commercial potential is exceptional and the virtual Jordan may make millions.

articles.title: Meta's Zuckerberg hiring for new 'superintelligence' AI team, Bloomberg News reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is setting up a team of experts to achieve artificial general intelligence (AGI) in tandem with a reported investment of over $10 billion in Scale AI. Zuckerberg will personally recruit around 50 people, including a new head of AI research for the AGI team. Bloomberg News could not immediately verify the report.

articles.title: Meta's Zuckerberg is hiring for new AI team, Bloomberg News reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is setting up a team of experts to achieve artificial general intelligence, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday. Reuters could not immediately verify the report.    .      in this case, the report could not be immediately verified by Reuters.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 3:00 a.m. EDT
articles.summary: Scammers are using AI to enroll fake students in online classes and steal college financial aid. The U.S. Education Department introduced a temporary rule requiring new financial aid applicants to show a government-issued ID to prove their identity to fight the fraud.

articles.title: Protests Against Artificial Intelligence Planned For Annecy Animation Fest
articles.author: Max Goldbart
articles.summary: Protests against the use of artificial intelligence in animation are planned at this week's Annecy fest. The main fears revolve around layoffs as more and more animated processes become automated. Last year, audience members booed the screening of Chien Mechant's French music video Etoile Filante, made using generative AI software.

articles.title: Virtuals Ecosystem Rebounds as AI Agent Market Climbs Back to $9.64B
articles.author: NULLTX
articles.summary: The AI agent sector regained strength this week as the markets gained momentum and investor sentiment became bullish. In the past 72 hours, the total market capitalization of AI agents rose 2.09% and hit $9.64 billion. The market value of the AI agents has now reached $10 billion.

articles.title: Crypto social media sees rising interest in AI taking jobs: Santiment
articles.author: Stephen Katte
articles.summary: Santiment's Alpha Narratives dashboard tracks top words that are grabbing major interest on social media and driving the crypto markets. Santiment found that between May 29 and June 5, users were discussing various aspects of AI, including job displacement, efficiency and effectiveness in industries, more than crypto.

articles.title: Apple keeps it simple on AI, unveils 'liquid glass' redesign
articles.summary: Apple unveiled a series of upgrades to its AI tech on Monday. They focus on tools to help with everyday life, including live translation of phone calls and messages. The company will open up its AI model to third-party developers. Apple also unveiled a new design language for its operating systems, dubbed 'liquid glass'.

articles.title: U.S. State Department cable says agency using AI to help staff job panels
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: The U.S. State Department will use an artificial intelligence chatbot to help it select the people who will perform annual reviews of promotions and moves, according to a cable. The chatbot will be able to make decisions on behalf of the State Department.

articles.title: Don't Give AI Open Invitation to Invade
articles.author: Tiffany White
articles.summary: Ted Cruz is the Chair of the Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. He should support states' ability to regulate AI and to protect consumer interests. The administration's 'Big Beautiful Bill' includes a provision that would render states powerless to develop and enforce regulations on AI for a decade.

articles.title: Commentary: Delaying state-level AI oversight creates national security risks — Katrina Rosseini
articles.author: Katrina Rosseini
articles.summary: The House of Representatives recently passed a bill imposing a 10-year federal moratorium on state-level AI regulations. The bill aims to create uniformity, but it strips states of their constitutional right to regulate emerging technologies. Without the authority to regulate AI-related risks, the United States risks leaving its critical infrastructure exposed to devastating attacks. AI adoption could boost global GDP by 15 percentage points by 2035. North America is expected to see a 14.5% increase.

articles.title: Apple faces AI, regulatory challenges as it woos software developers
articles.summary: Some of Apple's executives are set to take the stage on Monday at the company's annual software developer conference. Many of the long-awaited artificial-intelligence features Apple promised a year ago have been delayed until next year. Courts in the US and Europe are poised to pull down the walls around Apple's App Store. Donald Trump has threatened 25% tariffs on Apple's best-selling iPhone. Apple's shares are down more than 40% since the start of the year.

articles.title: Apple's AI event falls flat as iPhone maker struggles
articles.author: Alex Singleton
articles.summary: Apple's flagship annual showcase has fallen flat as the iPhone maker fails to allay concerns that it is falling behind on artificial intelligence developments. The American tech giant was struck by a sell-off on Monday evening after it became apparent that its keynote presentation would only include minor software upgrades.

articles.title: Coleman among attorneys general concerned over Meta AI
articles.author: TOM LATEK
articles.summary: Kentucky Attorney General Russell Coleman is part of a group calling upon Meta Platforms, Inc. to address concerns about its artificial intelligence assistant, known as "Meta AI," which may expose children to sexually explicit content and allow adults to simulate grooming of minors.

articles.title: AI Thesis Unveils Reliable Prostate Cancer Pathology
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Nita Mulliqi is a PhD student at Karolinska Institutet. She developed and tested artificial intelligence (AI) models that can help pathologists to analyse digital images of prostate biopsies. She believes future research should focus on prospective clinical trials and integrating AI tools into clinical workflows.

articles.title: Amazon doubles down on AI with $20B Pennsylvania investment
articles.author: Stephen Katte
articles.summary: Amazon is planning to invest $20 billion in two new data centers in Pennsylvania and $10 billion in North Carolina to expand its AI infrastructure. The location for the data centers is still up in the air, but Salem Township and Falls Township are the frontrunners. Amazon has partnered with Pennsylvania educational institutions and workforce organizations to create training centers that support careers in cloud computing infrastructure. US firms have begun ramping up AI expansion.

articles.title: Apple announced new AI features, including deep ChatGPT integration across its devices
articles.author: Nellius Irene
articles.summary: Apple announced several new AI features at its Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) on Monday, June 9. The announcements emphasized deeper integration with OpenAI's ChatGPT, tighter privacy controls, and fresh developer tools while rolling out a sweeping design overhaul. The company's long-anticipated overhaul of its Siri voice assistant remains in development.

articles.title: Palantir - Birth of the American Police State
articles.author: Donna Hancock
articles.summary: ChatGPT 4.1 is an AI-based chat app. It allows one to have interesting conversations with AI. In one of them, ChatGPT and Trump discuss Palantir and the use of its technology for surveillance. It's refreshing to have a cool-headed and unbiased analysis of this issue.

articles.title: AI Tackles Live Oyster Detection
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Global oyster populations have plummeted by more than 85% from historical levels. Traditional methods of oyster reef monitoring involve destructive sampling and manual labor. A new deep learning model, ODYSSEE, was trained to identify live oysters from underwater imagery. Researchers pitted the model against both expert and non-expert human annotators to evaluate its accuracy and speed.

articles.title: Adobe Expands AI agentic offerings, adds new agent capabilities in Adobe experience platform
articles.author: Adgully Bureau
articles.summary: Product Support Agent is designed to support marketing and customer experience teams in their Adobe Experience Platform applications by providing an interactive way to troubleshoot, diagnose, and escalate issues. Data Insights Agent is the first agent built on the Adobe Experience platform Agent Orchestrator.

articles.title: Terry Savage: AI used to guide seniors to Medicare programs
articles.author: Terry Savage
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is becoming a useful tool for business and individuals. Social Security will soon be using AI in its call centers. eHealth uses AI to start the process of guiding seniors to the appropriate choices for Medicare programs. iHealth is a popular health insurance marketplace that helps people find the right insurance coverage.

articles.title: Sobot Reveals "AI-First" Strategy for Delivering Human-like Customer Service
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Sobot, a leading AI customer contact solution provider, unveiled its "AI-First" strategy at a media launch event this month. According to MarketsandMarkets, the global AI-for-customer-service market was valued at USD 12.06 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach USD 47.82 billion by 2030.

articles.title: AlterNet's Code of Standards for Artificial Intelligence
articles.summary: AlterNet is experimenting with the use of artificial intelligence in its journalism. The policy will be revisited in six months or sooner if circumstances warrant it. It prohibits the uses of AI to generate entire news articles for publication without human authorship and oversight. It also prohibits the use to generate made-up attributions or non-existent sources.
